intro: Phacelia nervosa, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to violet flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has a short growing season and is often found in disturbed areas. Its small, hairy leaves and showy blooms make it a desirable plant for pollinators and ecological restoration projects.
